com.digby.localpoint.sdk.core

Interface ILPLocationProvider


  • public interface ILPLocationProvider
    A location provider acts as a store for locations deemed "relevant" by the SDK.

    A location provider can be used by an application in two ways:

    1. synchronous - The provider can be queried for locations currently known to it.
    2. asynchronous - An application can register a listener that will be notified when locations known are added to, deleted from or modified in the provider.

    Since:
    1.0.0
    Version:
    1.1.0

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Adds the given listener to this provider.
      ILPLocationFilterFactory getFilterFactory()
      Returns the location filter factory associated with this provider.

      Returns a location with the given identifier.
      List<ILPLocation> getLocations()
      Returns all locations known to this provider.

      Returns the location ordering factory associated with this provider.

    • Method Detail

      • addListener

        void addListener(ILPLocationListener listener)
        Adds the given listener to this provider.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to be added (must never be null)

      • getFilterFactory

        ILPLocationFilterFactory getFilterFactory()
        Returns the location filter factory associated with this provider.

        This method should never return null.

        Returns:
        the location filter factory associated with this provider

      • getLocation

        ILPLocation getLocation(ILPID id)
        Returns a location with the given identifier.
        Parameters:
        id - the identifier of the location to be returned (must never be null)
        Returns:
        the location with the given identifier (if such a location is currently known to this provider) or null if otherwise

      • getLocations

        List<ILPLocation> getLocations()
        Returns all locations known to this provider.

        This is equivalent to calling getLocations(ILPFilter, ILPOrdering) with null for both arguments.

        Returns:
        the (possibly empty) list of locations known to this provider

      • getLocations

        List<ILPLocation> getLocations(ILPFilter filter,
                             ILPOrdering ordering)
        Returns all locations filtered by the given filter and sorted by the given ordering.
        Parameters:
        filter - the filter to be applied to the locations to be returned (if null, acts as a filter that accepts all locations; see ILPLocationFilterFactory.getAllFilter())
        ordering - the ordering to be applied to the locations to be returned (if null, acts as ILPLocationOrderingFactory.getAscendingDistanceOrdering() )
        Returns:
        the (possibly empty) list of locations that satisfy the given filter and ordering

      • getOrderingFactory

        ILPLocationOrderingFactory getOrderingFactory()
        Returns the location ordering factory associated with this provider.

        This method should never return null.

        Returns:
        the location ordering factory associated with this provider

      • removeAllListeners

        void removeAllListeners()
        Removes all listeners from this provider.

      • removeListener

        void removeListener(ILPLocationListener listener)
        Removes the given listener from this provider.

        This method has no effect if the given listener is not registered with this provider.

        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to remove (must never be null)
